name: Hilton Beijing Wangfujing

reviews.title: Impeccable!
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights and have the following comments
Pros
reviews.title: Great hotel near centre with good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - GREAT area, right at Wangfujing with several high and medium end malls around
reviews.title: Amazing hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Wonderful service by bell-hops, concierge lounge staff and reception
reviews.title: Great Location, Wonderful Staff

reviews.text: - Modern decor as the hotel is very few (I believed it opened just before Olympics)
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel, its service, and luxury -- a Diamond Rating from a Diamond Member

reviews.text: The hotel is very nice, concierge is excellent. They will print you out maps in Chinese (I recommend this) for a taxi as well as lend you an umbrella for the day, answer general questions, put you in a cab & make sure the driver knows where you are going. You can also book tours through the hotel at the concierge if you have a day off.
reviews.title: Great hotel, touristy location.
Worth every penny
reviews.text: -This hotel is in a very modern/western area of the city (by a big mall w a Starbucks, Gap, etc.), BUT on the plus side, also only a 15/20 min walk from The Forbidden City/Tiananmen Sq & the pedestrian mall attached to the mall is quite nice.

-I did book a GrayLine tour to The Great Wall through the hotel. There was a blizzard, but the tour guide still got us to a different section of The Wall. Since this was the only day I could go, I was grateful to see any section! But beware, as with all tour groups, you are taken to a tea shop & jade shop to try to get you to buy things. You cannot get out of this, but they are not too pushy, so it is okay.
reviews.title: China

reviews.text: -I also suggest you arrange for a car to the hotel. It seems extravagant, but most taxi drivers in China where I was, speak NO English.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Worth the Money

reviews.text: -AND, it is quite cold in early November. Bring a winter coat, hat, scarves, gloves!
reviews.title: Great Hilton

reviews.text: We were here 6 nights with our boys, 16 and 9. We all loved this hotel. The rooms are enormous and comfortable. The food is superb. But the most outstanding aspect of this hotel is the staff. Everyone here is absolutely dedicated to making sure all of your needs are met. The warm welcome from this hotel started the moment we stepped off the airplane! We had arranged for the hotel to pick us up at the airport. We were pleasantly surprised to be greated by someone at the end of the jetway. He escorted us to baggage claim and through immigration, to our driver. The concierge patiently confirmed and arranged our flight at the end fo the week to Guilin; in fact, when she was having trouble getting it done while I waited, she offered to finish the arrangements on her own so that I could go off and enjoy the day. These are just a couple of examples of how the hotel works hard to anticipate your needs. I hope to return to Beijing and would not think of staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Fantastic six nights with the family, start to finish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Welcoming from the moment we arrived. Plenty of wow factor but always in tasteful and well planned way. King Deluxe room was biggest of its class anywhere and came with everything you could possibly want. Took inclusive breakfast option and what a set up before a day out....choice, quality and style, overwhelming ! Great location for sights, shops and atmosphere. Very helpful and willing front of house staff for information, advice and recommendations. Great pool after tiring days out. If it was possible, eleven out of ten. This was our first visit yet we were treated like returning old friends.
reviews.title: Staying in Beijing? Stay here !

reviews.text: i wouldnt be used to staying in 5 star hotels.. but could not fault this hotel in any way.. superb rooms/beds etc, great food, excellent location.. most places are nearby on foot which in a vast place like beijing helps..
reviews.title: one of the best hotels ive ever stayed in if not the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Wangfujing is the perfect location for the Forbidden City, Tian'men square, the National center for the arts and the famous Beijing night food market. We were withing a short walking distance of all of these sights along with shopping centers and restaurants. The Hilton was beautiful and our room was stylish and comfortable. The restaurants in the hotel providing many choices for eating in and we chose to do that for several meals. The breakfast buffet offered many choices for all tastes--Asian and Western. There was also a wonderful pastry selection and eggs to order. The service was just top notch and we enjoyed being treated with such friendliness and respect. Everyone we encountered spoke excellent English. We highly recommend this Hilton.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and perfect location

reviews.text: Great experience staying in this hotel. Executive lounge is great for a drink. The kids enjoyed the swimming pool. Will come again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Family Vacation

reviews.text: great hotel and location. Largest room and hotel bathroom I have ever enjoyed.
reviews.title: beautiful and spacious room

reviews.text: This was our first stop on our trip to China. We enjoyed the hotel and its facilities-- the pool is gorgeous and relaxing. The retaurants and bars in the hotel spoil you. Tired after sightseeing, we ate dinner one night at Chyna, and one night at Vasco's. The food at Chyna is very good, but the portions are small. Vasco's has a wonderful breakfast selection, fortunately breakfast was part of the package we purchased.
reviews.title: Western Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff tries hard to please-- they are well trained and courteous. We had just one glitch-- we checked into the hotel after 17 hours of traveling and were told one of our two rooms would be ready in one hour. No problem-- we went to the other room. 90 minutes later we call down and are told the hotel needs another 30 minutes. Wanting to give things a chance to work through and to not be an ugly traveler, we go downstairs for coffee and tea; 45 minutes later we check at the desk again and are told it will be another 30 minutes. At this point I asked the desk clerk for the Manager, who very quickly upgraded us and moved us into our second room.
reviews.title: disappointed

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious, modern and clean. The shower is in a large marble room-- the shower heads provide an incredible water massage.
reviews.title: Great location and hilton standards

reviews.text: The hotel is close to the Beijing night market and to the Wangfujing shopping area.
reviews.title: You could not ask for more...a great base for Beijing

reviews.text: Here on Government and other business, got a deluxe room, best i have seen in China, well laid out with plenty of space, has a large store room and walk in robe, definitely recommend. Good location as well but concierge average
reviews.title: Hilton Beijing Wangfujing

reviews.text: Stayed at this exceptional hotel as part of a "private" tour of China for six people. The check in experience was one of the best with the staff escorting us to our suites. The rooms were huge with lavish furnishings.
reviews.title: The Best Hilton
Beautiful room
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was fantastic with fresh ingredients and huge selections. The bathroom was well designed with exclusive toiletries.

Now let us talk about the location.....right next door to Wangfujing with shops, restaurants, market stalls...you can eat as cheap or as expensive as you wish...you shop in upmarket shops or simply pick a bargain from the market stalls.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: I wish I could stay longer in this lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: I Have been more tha 18 times in Beijing in different 5 star hotels, and I want to say that this is the best. Rooms are very wide and warm, location is fantastic: Staff are extremely warm and helpfull, specially Olga at the reception. At the Vascos restaurant I had lunch they have a complete buffet chinese and western and waiters are so warm and professionals.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will come back when visiting Beijing for business or holiday
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The stay started out perfectly: we arrived at 10 am, and the registration person said, "there is always a room available for Diamond members." Ah, if this were only true at every Hilton property.
reviews.title: outstanding

reviews.text: Room well-appointed and service highly attentive for the first two days - it was almost as if they knew we were leaving the room so they could spiff up, bring in a flower or cookie platter, etc. Startlingly hard to get cabs from this hotel - we waited for 10 minutes on a cold Sunday night while the doorman frantically tried valiantly to flag down a cab for us - we ended up taking the subway instead.
reviews.title: 2nd thoughts? This is the one!

reviews.text: Steps from the pedestrian mall on Wangfujing, easy walk to Gugong and Qianmen.
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.text: This is one of my favorate Hilton hotels in China. The rooms are large and modern. I have stayed on business and stayed last summer with my family incuding a 1-1/2 year old. The staff is always attentive and professional. One of the guys even remembers my name and where I am from (and I only only stay 3-4 times a year). The location is central with walking distance to Forbidden City, Tieneman Square, and shopping. It's also a short cab ride to most govt offices. I do not recommend the hotel restaraunts as they are over priced with small portions. The western food is not up to Hilton quality.
reviews.title: Great Location for Business and Fun

reviews.text: We stayed at the Wangfujing Hilton last year for 15 nights. When we booked I was not that exited as Hiltons are generally quite dull. However this was different and we had a amazing time. We arrived at 7 in the morning and the room was not available until about 11.00 but they let us have it anyway which after a long flight is sublime.
reviews.title: heaven

reviews.text: We were there just before the big celebrations and the government had paid all the hotels on the main route not to fill the rooms so the hotel was quite empty. We were upgraded to a really large suite - we didn't realise this until we got a tour of all the other rooms. The room was amazing with really comfortable beds and a pillow menu - plus all the same stuff as the others have mentioned. The pool was finished and is amazing with 2 big water falls. We had the spa, gym and pool to ourselves every day but the gym is quite small and may not be so nice if full. There is an amazing smell as you walk in that is really relaxing and the whole design of the place is very luxurious - you cant help but just relax as soon as you walk in the door.
reviews.title: stunning room and good location

reviews.text: The staff could not have done enough for us - all very young and friendly - printing out addresses for taxi drivers and making sure we got to all the obscure places we wanted to see - even packing and posting all our excess luggage. They were always smiling and friendly even though some of the guests were obviously being really rude to them ( WHY do people do that ??)
reviews.title: Top notch service, top notch location

reviews.text: During our stay the government closed the streets around all the hotel to allow a parade rehearsal so no one could leave or enter the hotel from 5.00 pm Friday evening until Saturday evening. As we had to work Friday evening and Saturday they arranged a limo to take us to the other Hilton on the 3rd ring , where we were upgraded and provided with a car to take us to and from work - they could not have done enough for us - word of warning do not try the spa at the other Hilton as it is terrible - Wangfujing spa is really good.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel

reviews.text: This is a high quality hotel in a great location for downtown Beijing.
reviews.title: Business trip to Beijing

reviews.text: Very close to Tienanmen Square and the Forbidden City, 10 mins walk..
reviews.title: Cold and uninviting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main restaurant is Vascos and it is very good. The Buffet is always fresh and appetising with a big selection.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The swimming pool is nice and pretty quiet when I used it.
reviews.title: A fabulous hotel at a great location

reviews.text: The Executive Lounge on the 16th floor is OK but not much more. The staff are great - friendly, helpful and willing to do whatever is necessary, immediately. The selection of food for the Afternoon tea is very poor. The drinks and service during the Happy Hour is good but the food choices are poor, all when compared to the Hilton at the Beijing Airport and downtown Shanghai Hilton.
reviews.title: Nice location, excellent style

description: Hilton Beijing Wangfujing sets the standard for modern comfort. Located on famous Wangfujing Street, the hotel is within an easy walk to the Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square. This intimate, lifestyle hotel features 255 guestrooms and suites with highly sophisticated in-room entertainment. The Hilton Beijing Wangfujing specializes in pairing ideal meeting venues with impeccable service. Gourmet palates will relish the fine range of restaurants and lounges offering an eclectic choice of contemporary cuisine and cocktails in chic surroundings. Escape to the peaceful, rejuvenating solitude of the spa. Combining traditional Chinese hospitality with warm and personalized service and an intimate lifestyle ambience, Hilton Beijing Wangfujing is worth discovering.
